thread.title_full: Burnaby senior reported missing after failing to meet family member Thursday - BC | Globalnews.ca

author: Amy Judd
title: Burnaby senior reported missing after failing to meet family member Thursday - BC | Globalnews.ca
text:
February 17, 2017 9:14 am Updated: February 17, 2017 9:15 am Burnaby senior reported missing after failing to meet family member Thursday By Amy Judd Online News Producer Global News 
Sultanali Mohamed Dharamshi has been missing since Thursday evening. Burnaby RCMP handout What is this? 
Sponsored content is written by Global News' editorial staff without any editorial influence by the sponsor. If you'd like to learn more... X What is this? 
Sponsored content is written by Global News' without any editorial influence by the sponsor. If you'd like to learn more... - Listen 
A Burnaby senior has been reported missing to RCMP after failing to meet up with a family member Thursday evening. 
Sultanali Mohamed Dharamshi was supposed to go to the local mosque near his home but was not there when a family member went to meet with him. 
Dharamshi was last heard from around 6 p.m. 
RCMP say he is described as a: Middle Eastern male 5 ft 4 in (163 cm) 99 lbs (45 kg) Bald with grey hair on the sides brown eyes Walks with a cane 
Police say this behaviour is highly out-of-character for Sultanali and the Burnaby RCMP is trying to locate him to confirm well-being. Anyone with information regarding his whereabouts is urged to call the Burnaby RCMP Missing Persons Unit at 604 294-7922 or Crimestoppers at 1-800-222-8477 (TIPS).
